summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with Michael Turnball, a security contractor hired in July 2019 to provide security for Jeffrey Epstein's private islands, Little St. James and Great St. James. Turnball describes his hiring, duties, restrictions, and the limited personnel he encountered on the islands.

persons.name: Michael Turnball
persons.context: Owner of MT Security, hired in July 2019 to provide security patrols on Epstein's islands Little St. James and Great St. James. He was interviewed by the FBI on Little St. James.

persons.name: Daphne Wallace
persons.context: Person who contacted and hired Michael Turnball for the security job on Little St. James in July 2019.

persons.name: Anna Rodriguez
persons.context: Property manager for Little St. James whom Michael Turnball met with regarding his security duties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and convicted sex offender who owned the islands Little St. James and Great St. James where the security was being provided.

connections.description: Wallace contacted and hired Turnball to provide security services for Epstein's islands.
Rodriguez, as property manager, met with Turnball regarding his security duties on the island.
Turnball was providing security services for properties owned by Epstein, though likely hired through intermediaries.

events.title: Turnball Begins Security Work
events.description: Michael Turnball started working security on Little St. James island.

events.title: FBI Investigation on Little St. James
events.description: FBI conducted an investigation on Little St. James island, Virgin Islands.

events.title: FBI Interview of Turnball
events.description: FBI agents interviewed Michael Turnball on Little St. James island regarding his security work for Epstein's properties.

locations: Little St. James (island, Virgin Islands, United States)
Great St. James (island, Virgin Islands, United States)
keyFacts: Security was hired for Epstein's private islands (Little St. James and Great St. James) starting in July 2019, after Epstein's death, to guard against paparazzi and unauthorized visitors.
Michael Turnball, the security contractor, was restricted to patrolling beaches and was not allowed inside any structures on the islands.
Turnball was required to sign a non-disclosure agreement as part of his employment for the Epstein properties.
The only people Turnball reported seeing on the islands were staff, attorneys, maintenance workers, and boat captains.
